algorithm_technique: Brute force with bitmasking to iterate through all possible assignments of good/bad people.
problem_summary_simple: Find the maximum number of good people given statements about others being good or bad.
problem_summary_technical: Iterate through all 2^n subsets of people using bitmasks, checking consistency of statements for each subset.
key_insights: The constraint n <= 15 strongly suggests an exponential time complexity solution, likely involving bitmasking.
A bitmask can represent the state of each person (good or bad).
For each bitmask, verify if all statements are consistent with the assumed good/bad assignments.
